alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 26 at 11:59PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern New Jersey, including the following county, Hunterdon. * WHEN...Until 400 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1157 PM EST, the Neshanic Creek went into Minor Flood Stage at Reaville (REAN4). Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southeastern Hunterdon County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
